title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
While pasta cooks, fry pancetta in a large skillet until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk eggs, grated cheeses, and black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water.
Quickly toss hot pasta with pancetta, then remove from heat.
Pour egg mixture over pasta, stirring quickly to coat. Add pasta water if needed for creaminess.
Serve immediately with extra grated cheese and black pepper.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, chili powder, 1 tsp garam masala, and ginger-garlic paste for 4 hours.
Grill or bake marinated chicken until cooked through.
In a large pan, simmer tomatoes until soft. Puree and strain.
In the same pan, add pureed tomatoes, remaining garam masala, and cream. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add grilled chicken to the sauce and cook for another 5 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve with naan bread or rice.

title: Classic Caesar Salad
summary: A crisp green salad with a creamy dressing and crunchy croutons.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together minced garlic, anchovy fillets, egg yolk, lemon juice, and mustard.
Slowly drizzle in olive oil while whisking to create an emulsion.
Season the dressing with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss chopped romaine with the dressing.
Add croutons and grated Parmesan cheese.
Toss again lightly and serve immediately.

title: Beef Stroganoff
summary: A creamy Russian dish of sautéed beef in a sour cream sauce, served over noodles.
instructions: Season beef with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, brown beef in oil over high heat. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, sauté onions and mushrooms until soft.
Sprinkle flour over vegetables and cook for 1 minute.
Gradually add beef broth, stirring constantly. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in mustard and sour cream. Add beef back to the skillet.
Meanwhile, cook egg noodles according to package instructions.
Serve beef mixture over noodles, garnished with parsley.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: A quick and healthy mix of colorful vegetables in a savory sauce.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snap peas)
1 tbsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil in a small bowl.
Pour sauce over vegetables and toss to coat.
Add cornstarch slurry and cook until sauce thickens.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Classic homemade cookies with gooey chocolate chips.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, cream together butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
Gradually blend in the dry ingredients.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 9 to 11 minutes or until golden brown.
Let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.

title: Greek Salad
summary: A refreshing salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and feta cheese.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion, bell pepper, feta cheese, and olives.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, and oregano.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.

title: Mushroom Risotto
summary: A creamy Italian rice dish with savory mushrooms and Parmesan cheese.
ingredients: 6 cups vegetable or chicken broth, heated
instructions: In a large pan, sauté mushrooms in 1 tbsp olive oil until browned. Set aside.
In the same pan, heat remaining oil and sauté onion and garlic until softened.
Add rice and stir for 1-2 minutes until lightly toasted.
Pour in wine and stir until absorbed.
Begin adding hot broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly and waiting for each addition to be absorbed before adding more.
Continue this process until rice is creamy and al dente, about 18-20 minutes.
Stir in mushrooms, Parmesan, and butter. Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

title: Banana Bread
summary: A moist and flavorful quick bread made with ripe bananas.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 4x8-inch loaf pan.
In a large bowl, mix mashed bananas with melted butter.
Mix in sugar, egg, and vanilla.
Sprinkle baking soda and salt over the mixture and stir in.
Add flour and mix until just combined.
Fold in chopped walnuts if using.
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let cool in the pan for a few minutes, then remove and cool completely on a wire rack.

title: Homemade Pizza
summary: A delicious pizza with a crispy crust and your favorite toppings.
ingredients: Toppings of your choice (e.g., pepperoni, mushrooms, bell peppers)
instructions: In a large bowl, mix flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
Add warm water and olive oil, mix until a dough forms.
Knead dough on a floured surface for about 5 minutes until smooth.
Place in a greased bowl, cover, and let rise for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).
Punch down dough and roll out on a floured surface.
Transfer to a pizza pan or baking sheet.
Spread tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a border for the crust.
Sprinkle with cheeses and add your chosen toppings.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
